critique: This document is a waiver of trade restrictions with Romania, based on section 402(c)(2) of the Trade Act of 1974. It's difficult to assess a strong ideological tilt based on this document alone. It seems to be a standard trade-related action. Immigration is not addressed. Executive power is being exercised, but within the bounds of existing law. Federalism is not directly implicated. National security vs. civil liberties is not a central concern. Economic regulation is touched upon, as the waiver likely reduces some trade barriers. Social inclusion is not directly relevant.
